thread.title: Media camping outside HKL showing signs of fatigue
thread.title_full: Media camping outside HKL showing signs of fatigue

author: JUSTIN ZACK
title: Media camping outside HKL showing signs of fatigue
text:
33 PM Media camping outside HKL showing signs of fatigue by justin zack Many have been here since early Saturday morning, surviving on canned coffee and junk food. 
KUALA LUMPUR: Reporters who have been camping outside the Hospital Kuala Lumpur morgue are showing signs of fatigue. 
Many have been here since early Saturday morning, surviving on canned coffee and junk food. 
Earlier in the day, the "media pit" in front of the morgue was bustling with excitement due to unconfirmed reports of a second postmortem being conducted on Kim Jong-nam. 
However, the lack of a police presence or embassy staff at the morgue quickly put paid to the rumour. 
Throughout the day, local and foreign media representatives were seen exchanging information, hoping for any update. 
Many media organisations started sending in their second shift to replace the morning crew, as of 5.30pm. Jong-nam, the half-brother of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, was allegedly killed by two women who splashed his face with a chemical at the KL International Airport 2 departure hall at about 9am on Monday. He was about to leave for Macau.
